alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greenwood; Laurens; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert, northwestern Laurens, southeastern Greenville, southern Spartanburg, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown to 7 miles southeast of Elberton. Movement was northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fountain Inn, Woodruff, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Gray Court, Lake Secession and Donalds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Greenwood; Laurens; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg
